examples: The repair is a cinch.
The student broke down a large project into smaller, more manageable tasks, as she believed that life is hard by the yard but by the inch life's a cinch.
And they cinch the zip ties tight.
Then they close their bell around the prey and cinch themselves up tight like a trash bag.
We've given him good-tasting treats from the syringe before, so giving him medication now is a cinch.
words.defineEn: someone who will surely do something; something that will surely happen
words.defineVi: một người chắc chắn sẽ làm điều gì đó; một cái gì đó chắc chắn sẽ xảy ra

examples: The repair is a cinch.
The student broke down a large project into smaller, more manageable tasks, as she believed that life is hard by the yard but by the inch life's a cinch.
And they cinch the zip ties tight.
Then they close their bell around the prey and cinch themselves up tight like a trash bag.
We've given him good-tasting treats from the syringe before, so giving him medication now is a cinch.
words.defineEn: to make certain of or to guarantee something
words.defineVi: để chắc chắn về hoặc để đảm bảo một cái gì đó

examples: Leave the concrete to set for a few hours.
The CEO gave a great speech about the company's commitment to social responsibility, but talk is cheap unless they start implementing concrete actions to reduce their carbon footprint.
So the concrete is inherently stronger.
The concrete industry uses about 3 trillion liters of water a year.
"The concrete evidence is right here."
words.defineEn: according to facts instead of opinions
words.defineVi: theo sự thật thay vì ý kiến

examples: What, concretely, does the AMA plan to do, given now the history that is known?

Henry: To see concretely how strange this is, let’s look at a particular arrangement of our three filters: A, oriented vertically, B, oriented 22.5 degrees from vertical, and C, oriented 45 degrees from vertical.
words.defineEn: in a definite and clear manner due to being based on facts instead of ideas or guesses
words.defineVi: một cách xác định và rõ ràng do được dựa trên sự kiện thay vì ý tưởng hoặc phỏng đoán

examples: He lost confidence and backed out of the deal at the last minute.
We have confidence in the police's ability to investigate and solve crimes.
Olivia shows her skin with confidence, wearing a swimsuit at the beach.
The performance improved as their confidence grew.
He clearly knew the game backward and forward and had confidence in his opinions.
words.defineEn: the belief in one's own ability to achieve goals and get the desired results
words.defineVi: niềm tin vào khả năng của chính mình để đạt được mục tiêu và có được kết quả mong muốn

examples: Both men wore confident smiles.
She felt confident and beautiful in her new swimsuit.
I'm confident that the new restaurant will go like a bomb and become a popular dining destination.
And nothing was so irritating as the confident way he used archaic idiom.
During the chess tournament, Jane was confident in her skills, but her opponent ended up cleaning her clock with a series of surprising moves.
words.defineEn: being certain about our plans, abilities, the future, etc. and believing that we can gain success
words.defineVi: chắc chắn về kế hoạch, khả năng, tương lai của mình, v.v. và tin rằng chúng ta có thể đạt được thành công

examples: The girl with the carrot top confidently embraces her unique hair color, radiating a sense of individuality.
The salesman confidently presented his product, knowing that good wine needs no bush.
She held her head high as she walked confidently into the room.
The expert confidently stated that it had been sunny with excellent visibility on the day in question.
No one could confidently know the age of the earth before the discovery of radioactivity and the development of radiometric dating in the early twentieth century.
words.defineEn: in a way that shows confidence and trust in oneself or another person's abilities, plans, etc.
words.defineVi: theo cách thể hiện sự tự tin và tin tưởng vào khả năng, kế hoạch của bản thân hoặc người khác, v.v.

examples: He has the courage of his convictions.
The conviction of the billionaire sends a message to the world that no one gets a free pass to break the law.
Lead your own life and have the courage of your convictions.
When we learned of the conviction, we dropped him like a hot potato.
George is a decent fella, it's just that he lacks the courage of his convictions.
words.defineEn: a belief or opinion that is very strong
words.defineVi: một niềm tin hoặc ý kiến đó là rất mạnh mẽ

examples: He is convinced talk of a leadership challenge will come to nothing.
When I voted for him I was convinced he would win, but I backed the wrong horse!
Convinced I was.
Are you convinced?
But not everyone is convinced.
words.defineEn: having a strong belief in something or being certain about it
words.defineVi: có một niềm tin mạnh mẽ vào một cái gì đó hoặc chắc chắn về nó

examples: He counted on his fingers to solve the math problem.
You can count on him to be there in weal and woe.
I can always count on my bosom buddy to be there for me.
You gave your word, and people are counting on you.
We knew we could count on him to come up with the goods.
words.defineEn: to rely on or to put trust in something or someone
words.defineVi: dựa vào hoặc đặt niềm tin vào một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: It also serves as a cross-check of the results that analytical engineers produce.
words.defineEn: to check the accuracy or validity of something by using alternative sources or methods
words.defineVi: để kiểm tra tính chính xác hoặc tính hợp lệ của một cái gì đó bằng cách sử dụng các nguồn hoặc phương pháp thay thế

examples: It also serves as a cross-check of the results that analytical engineers produce.
words.defineEn: ‌an act of determining the accuracy or credibility of something by comparing it with various sources
words.defineVi: ‌một hành động xác định độ chính xác hoặc độ tin cậy của một cái gì đó bằng cách so sánh nó với các nguồn khác nhau

examples: She had a decidedly down-at-heel appearance.
It is decidedly so.
Whales are a decidedly non-renewable resource.
I'm not interested in that with this plan, because this plan is decidedly not that.
This was one of the first times it’s really so effectively and decidedly directed at a Supreme Court nominee.
words.defineEn: in a way that is certain and beyond any doubt
words.defineVi: theo một cách chắc chắn và không còn nghi ngờ gì nữa

examples: We'll just have to play it by ear until we can get something definite sorted out.
I want that definite answer.
The war had a definite cause: unbridled military expansion by Germany, Japan, and, to a small extent, Italy.
She's definite, definite.
She's definite, definite.
words.defineEn: certainly happening and unlikely to change
words.defineVi: chắc chắn xảy ra và không thể thay đổi

examples: We'll just have to play it by ear until we can get something definite sorted out.
I want that definite answer.
The war had a definite cause: unbridled military expansion by Germany, Japan, and, to a small extent, Italy.
She's definite, definite.
She's definite, definite.
words.defineEn: someone who is sure to do something or something that is sure to happen or one is certain about
words.defineVi: ai đó chắc chắn sẽ làm điều gì đó hoặc điều gì đó chắc chắn sẽ xảy ra hoặc người ta chắc chắn về

examples: My best friend's pink hair definitely raised a few eyebrows at our very strict school.
I definitely felt the importance of the occasion.
You should definitely bake a brie with cranberry sauce.
Speaking that rudely to your teacher definitely crosses the line.
Going to the beach is definitely my scene.
words.defineEn: in a certain or definite way
words.defineVi: theo một cách nhất định hoặc xác định

examples: His humour did not depend on punchlines.
In the end, it simply depends on each one giving a hand at the right moment.
You couldn't do a better job fixing this truck if your life depended on it!
It depends on how much that country greased their hands so that they lined up their pockets.
Narrator: The size of the pearl largely depends on the size of the mollusk.
words.defineEn: put trust in with confidence
words.defineVi: đặt niềm tin vào với sự tự tin

examples: His humour did not depend on punchlines.
In the end, it simply depends on each one giving a hand at the right moment.
You couldn't do a better job fixing this truck if your life depended on it!
It depends on how much that country greased their hands so that they lined up their pockets.
Narrator: The size of the pearl largely depends on the size of the mollusk.
words.defineEn: put trust in with confidence
words.defineVi: đặt niềm tin vào với sự tự tin

words.defineEn: being convinced that everything one believes in is true and others are wrong
words.defineVi: bị thuyết phục rằng mọi thứ một người tin vào là đúng và những người khác là sai

words.defineEn: in a critical and arrogant manner therefore refusing to consider other's opinions
words.defineVi: theo cách chỉ trích và kiêu ngạo do đó từ chối xem xét ý kiến của người khác

examples: A very extensive research and development programme ensures that we're ahead of the game.
She ensured that the lamb's lettuce received enough sunlight and water.
He always ensures that his outfit is impeccable, never a hair out of place.
The zookeepers took special care of the baby elephant, ensuring its healthy growth.
Harvesting abalone for culinary purposes requires sustainable practices to ensure the long-term survival of it.
words.defineEn: to make sure that something will happen
words.defineVi: để chắc chắn rằng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra

words.phonetic: tə fiːl slæʃ noʊ ɛstiːeɪtʃ ɪn wʌn bækslæʃ ɛs boʊnz
words.defineEn: to believe something strongly, even though one cannot explain why
words.defineVi: để tin tưởng một cái gì đó mạnh mẽ, mặc dù người ta không thể giải thích tại sao

examples: So it's not a foregone conclusion that it's going to be Nancy Pelosi.
but anyway, this all raises an interesting question: Was the result of the war a foregone conclusion?
However, some market experts remain skeptical of drawing foregone conclusion based solely on market data.
That was a foregone conclusion: He would never get out of committee.
For us, the key focus was building a company that was going to be relevant and that was not a foregone conclusion, certainly not in the time that we were developing those products.
words.defineEn: something that is assumed to be true or already decided upon before any evidence or arguments are presented
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được cho là đúng hoặc đã được quyết định trước khi đưa ra bất kỳ bằng chứng hoặc lập luận nào

words.defineEn: to make someone understand something completely and clearly
words.defineVi: để làm cho ai đó hiểu một cái gì đó hoàn toàn và rõ ràng

examples: Not even the most talented athlete is guaranteed a long career.
Blue blood is no guarantee of any particular merit, competence, or expertise.
Winning one game does not guarantee success for the entire season.
If you leave your science project in my way, I can't guarantee I won't step on it!
The talented athlete has it made with a lucrative contract and sponsorships that guarantee their financial security.
words.defineEn: to make sure that something will occur
words.defineVi: để đảm bảo rằng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra

examples: Not even the most talented athlete is guaranteed a long career.
Blue blood is no guarantee of any particular merit, competence, or expertise.
Winning one game does not guarantee success for the entire season.
If you leave your science project in my way, I can't guarantee I won't step on it!
The talented athlete has it made with a lucrative contract and sponsorships that guarantee their financial security.
words.defineEn: something that makes certain of a given result
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó làm cho chắc chắn của một kết quả nhất định

examples: [and] saw himself as their guarantor and their guardian.
words.defineEn: a person who officially makes a promise or gives assurance to be accountable for someone or the occurrence of something
words.defineVi: một người chính thức đưa ra lời hứa hoặc đảm bảo chịu trách nhiệm cho ai đó hoặc sự xuất hiện của một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to assume without question that something is true
words.defineVi: để cho rằng không có câu hỏi rằng một cái gì đó là đúng
